image.altText: boxing glove

props.synopsis: Some parents say they saw an almost immediate improvement in their children's self-confidence after starting martial arts. But it's not about using violence to address violence.

title.children: Frustrated with bullying, these parents enrolled their kids in self-defence

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Nicole Williams pleaded guilty to attempted aggravated burglary and accessory after the fact to murder for her involvement in the death of Glenn Walewicz, and was today sentenced to seven years in jail.

title.children: It was a killing that baffled police. Now its mastermind has been jailed

image.altText: Three women look at the camera.

props.synopsis: Not sure what to pack for your baby during a disaster? The Australian Breastfeeding Association has prepared a guide.

title.children: Mum rues leaving baby essentials behind in bushfire evacuation 'mad rush'

image.altText: A 10-year-old boy in a Ferrari cap stands on a karting track with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: While other Year 5 students are playing football or reading a book, Canberran Lazarus AÃ±onuevo is turning heads on go-karting circuits around Australia and overseas in his pursuit to become a Formula One driver.

title.children: Canberra go-karting prodigy making Formula One dream a reality

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell plays a shot against England at the Champions Trophy.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia "postponed" its 2021 Test match with Afghanistan over concerns about the Taliban's human rights abuses against women, and did not play in the subsequent 2023 or 2024 series, but says it will fulfil its ICC Champions Trophy tournament obligations.

title.children: Australian cricket team play Afghanistan despite boycotting other matches

image.altText: a girl holds a puppy

props.synopsis: Year Six student, Anais Betts, from the Central Coast, suffered a critical injury when she was hit by a falling tree branch during an excursion.

title.children: Student injured on excursion remains in critical condition more than a week on

image.altText: The Aunty Jack Show colour 2

props.synopsis: Fifty years ago the first Australian television program was broadcast in colour, about 10 years after it had arrived in most countries around the world.

title.children: Australia first saw colour television 10 years late, but it arrived with a big bang

image.altText: Young girl holding an exceptionally large apple, 1930

props.synopsis: The National Library's latest exhibition, Fit to Print: Defining Moments from the Fairfax Photo Archive, comprises around 150 photographs that illustrate moments in Australian history from the 1890s until the late 1940s.

title.children: New exhibition 'traces the birth of photojournalism in this country'

image.altText: A fishing boat listing on the ocean after crashing into rocks.

props.synopsis: Beaches at a popular New South Wales Far South Coast tourist town have become littered with debris after a commercial fishing vessel ran aground this week.

title.children: Idyllic beaches littered with debris and diesel from NSW shipwreck

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton send clear signals that we stand as a nation with Ukraine but they are not dealing with the deeper reality that our once reliable American partner is no longer reliable in the same way.

title.children: Our alliance with the US is in crisis under Trump

image.altText: A landscape image of rainy conditions at the beach.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Alfred is expected to make landfall this week, bringing strong winds, tidal surges, heavy rainfall and the potential for "life-threatening" flooding.

title.children: Cyclone forecast to turn towards southern Queensland coast tomorrow

image.altText: Vincent Fantauzzo

props.synopsis: How the famous portrait of the Hollywood actor forged an enduring bond between his grieving father and the artist, Vincent Fantauzzo.

title.children: How Heath Ledger's death changed Vincent Fantauzzo's life

image.altText: Close up of phone with someone about to place a bet on a sports game

props.synopsis: About $32 billion a year is now lost by people betting online, mostly by those who can't afford it. A bill that would force online betting outfits to display to each client what they're losing, and what they've lost, each time they log on is hoped to change that.

title.children: We lose $32b a year to online gambling. A new bill might help reduce it

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens

props.synopsis: Months after the deaths of Holly Bowles and Bianca Jones, their families say they are furious at the lack of information from Lao authorities and want travellers to boycott the country until a proper investigation is held.

title.children: Parents of methanol poisoning victims describe investigation as 'disgraceful'

image.altText: An outdoor shopping strip.

props.synopsis: The ABC spoke to a number of people living in St Albans, in Melbourne's west, on issues that they see as key ahead of the federal election.Â

title.children: In Melbourne's west, cost-of-living pressures could sway key contests

image.altText: A Qantas plane taxies along a runway in overcast conditions while passengers seated inside watch on.

props.synopsis: Pacific Islanders spending large amounts of money trying to secure Australia's new permanent residency visa say the experience has left them dejected and anxious.

title.children: Applicants spend big, lose job offers as new visa scheme rolled out

image.altText: pope francis sits in wheelchair and waves

props.synopsis: The 88-year-old pontiff has been in hospital since mid-February after suffering an "isolated" breathing crisis, and has thanked wellwishers for their prayers.Â

title.children: Pope no longer needs breathing ventilator, Vatican says

image.altText: A close up view of a smoke stack at the Whyalla steelworks, taken at sunset

props.synopsis: Some business and climate groups have voiced their support for keeping one of the federal government's key climate policies in place, with the Coalition yet to commit to its future.

title.children: Australia's key climate policy faces an uncertain future

image.altText: A photo of Emmanuel College in Warrnambool, with several students sitting on the lawn

props.synopsis: A former teacher takes a Victorian Catholic school to the Fair Work Commission, alleging she was fired after raising concerns about bullying within staff.

title.children: Private school teacher allegedly sacked after flagging staff bullying

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A space craft hovers above the Moon

props.synopsis: A private lunar lander carrying equipment for NASA touches down on the Moon, the latest in a string of companies looking to kickstart business on Earth's celestial neighbour ahead of astronaut missions.

title.children: Private lunar lander Blue Ghost touches down on Moon

image.altText: An image of a concrete and wood apartment square block.

props.synopsis: Thirteen new designs for future building projects have been commissioned for the state's pattern book, though some architects are questioning whether a "one-size-fits-all" approach is a relevant housing solution.

title.children: 'Cookie cutter' pattern book designs missing the mark, says architect

image.altText: A lady with a headscarf, smiling and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis:
Young people consume vast amounts of information on personal finance on social media. But that thirst for financial knowledge is not translating into action when it comes to them managing their superannuation.

Â

title.children: Millennials missing out on thousands of dollars by ignoring their super

image.altText: Residential houses on a hill at sunset.

props.synopsis: Investing expert Margaret Lomas climbed the property ladder over decades, which delivered her housing and financial security. We meet desperate first home buyers and explain why emulating this success is now impossible.

title.children: ABC News Daily: The great (investor) dream

image.altText: Passenger plane and air traffic control tower at Sydney airport - good generic

props.synopsis: While flying remains the safest mode of transport, global aviation fatalities more than tripled between 2023 and 2024.

title.children: China's aviation market is second only to the US, but safety concerns abound

image.altText: Carlo Tizzano holds the ball in two hands  as he prepares to pass for Western Force.

props.synopsis: An Australian Super Rugby Pacific derby provides a form guide, as Wallabies contenders press their claims for selection to take on the British and Irish Lions later this year.

title.children: Force talent edges Wallabies star as fight for spots to face Lions heats up

image.altText: A composite image of three men in suits

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump up-ends world order during his first few weeks in power, Xi Jinping is quietly testing the boundaries of this new reality, and the fallout could be felt in Ukraine, Taiwan and Australia.Â

title.children: As Trump radically shifts the global order, Xi tests new boundaries

image.altText: Peter and Kirilly Dutton walk in a Lunar New Year parade in melbourne

props.synopsis: Of the 20 electorates considered in play this election, at least half of them have a Chinese-Australian population that is well above the national average

title.children: 'Pro-China' Dutton seeking to woo back crucial voters

image.altText: A woman looking at a clear board with post-it notes on it

props.synopsis:
Katie and Dan Toney grappled with a decision to move their family 800 kilometres interstate for a job opportunity. Â Â 
Â

title.children: 'I was really ready for a new chapter': Making a big location change for work

image.altText: A white and red passenger ship moored in a bay in an industrial area.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has instructed state-owned ferry operator TT-Line to stop lease negotiations for the Spirit of Tasmania IV and bring it home. The new vessel has been berthed in Scotland while the state government investigated leasing options.

title.children: Lease negotiations for new Spirit of Tasmania ditched, ferry to come home

image.altText: Jane Hume Katy Gallagher

props.synopsis: Frank and fearless advice about how Australia should navigate Trump's tariffs was lost in the din of election season.

title.children: Treasury came armed with a warning. Politicians dragged them into the mud

image.altText: Ryan Peake pumps his fists after winning NZ Open.

props.synopsis: Eleven years after being handed a prison sentence, former Rebels bikie gang member Ryan Peake completes a dramatic victory at the New Zealand Open.

title.children: Ex-Rebels bikie Peake wins New Zealand Open by one stroke

image.altText: Vasyl Myroshnychenko, dressed in green, speaks in front of a picture

props.synopsis: Ambassador Vasyl Myroshnychenko calls the Oval Office showdown between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy a "big shock".

title.children: Ukraine 'cannot survive' without ongoing US support, ambassador says

image.altText: Penrith Panthers Nathan Cleary, Liam Martin, Paul Alamoti and Izack Tago celebrate after an NRL try against Cronulla Sharks.

props.synopsis: Four-time defending premiers Penrith show their class as they beat the Sharks to open their NRL season in Las Vegas. Earlier, the Canberra Raiders thumped the Warriors and the Jillaroos humiliated England.

title.children: Panthers hold off Sharks to close out night of rugby league in Vegas

image.altText: A military helicopter lands in bushland, kicking up clouds of dust.

props.synopsis: An experienced army pilot has told an inquiry into the Taipan helicopter crash, which claimed the lives of four airmen, he would have considered not completing the mission had it been in similar conditions.

title.children: Fatal army mission 'failed as soon as they took off', Taipan inquiry hears
